history.content:
We are pleased to announce that EE198/EE298: "Hands-on ham radio" DeCal will be offered again this spring.
 
Getting an amateur radio license is easy -- just pass a simple exam (27/35 question of a 300 question pool). But what can you do with a license once you have one?
 
The class aims to briefly prepare student for the entry-level amateur radio exam, with a licensing session in the Wozniac room on Friday Feb 22nd. After that, the class will focus on hands on demonstrations, and experimentations -- basically playing a lot with radios!
 
What can you do as a ham?
- Talk to people (near and far)
- Build stuff (amplifiers, software radios, antennas, receivers)
- Emergency communications (emcom)
- First person view (FPV) vehicles (drones) at much higher power
- Communicate via satellites, moon, meteors, airplanes with radio waves!
- Digital communication with Automatic Positioning and Reporting System, packet radio
- Use Repeaters covering bay-area, California and the United States, mesh networks
Prerequisites: None!
 
Class meets weekly on Wednesday evening.
Join the over 450 students that have been licensed so far!
 
https://sites.google.com/berkeley.edu/ham-radio-sp19/home
history.subject: Sign up for EE198/EE298 "Hands-on ham radio"!
